eu.davidea.flexibleadapter

Class SelectableAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
      • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.SelectableAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FastScroller.AdapterInterface, FastScroller.BubbleTextCreator, FastScroller.OnScrollStateChangeListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimatorAdapter

    public abstract class SelectableAdapter
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
implements FastScroller.BubbleTextCreator, FastScroller.OnScrollStateChangeListener, FastScroller.AdapterInterface
    This class provides a set of standard methods to handle the selection on the items of an Adapter.

    Also it manages the FastScroller.

    This class is extended by AnimatorAdapter.
    Since:
    03/05/2015 Created
    27/01/2016 Improved Selection, SelectAll, FastScroller
    29/05/2016 Use of TreeSet instead of ArrayList
    04/04/2017 Use of FastScrollerDelegate
    05/06/2017 Improved Log system
    See Also:
    FlexibleAdapter, AnimatorAdapter

        public IFlexibleLayoutManager getFlexibleLayoutManager()

      • getMode

        public int getMode()
        The current selection mode of the Adapter.
        Returns:
        current mode
        Since:
        2.1.0
        See Also:
        SelectableAdapter.Mode.IDLE, SelectableAdapter.Mode.SINGLE, SelectableAdapter.Mode.MULTI

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Sets the mode of the selection:
        • SelectableAdapter.Mode.IDLE Default. Configures the adapter so that no item can be selected;
        • SelectableAdapter.Mode.SINGLE configures the adapter to react at the single tap over an item (previous selection is cleared automatically);
        • SelectableAdapter.Mode.MULTI configures the adapter to save the position to the list of the selected items.
        Parameters:
        mode - one of SelectableAdapter.Mode.IDLE, SelectableAdapter.Mode.SINGLE, SelectableAdapter.Mode.MULTI
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • isSelectAll

        public boolean isSelectAll()
        Returns:
        true if user clicks on SelectAll on action button in ActionMode.
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • isLastItemInActionMode

        public boolean isLastItemInActionMode()
        Returns:
        true if user returns to SelectableAdapter.Mode.IDLE or SelectableAdapter.Mode.SINGLE and no selection is active, false otherwise
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

        private void resetActionModeFlags()

        Since:

      • isSelectable

        public abstract boolean isSelectable(int position)
        Checks if the current item has the property selectable = true.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the item property selectable is true, false otherwise
        Since:
        5.0.0-b6

      • toggleSelection

        public void toggleSelection(int position)
        Toggles the selection status of the item at a given position.

        The behaviour depends on the selection mode previously set with setMode(int).

        The Activated State of the ItemView is automatically set in FlexibleViewHolder.toggleActivation() called in onClick event

        Usage:

        • If you don't want any item to be selected/activated at all, just don't call this method.
        • To have actually the item visually selected you need to add a custom Selector Drawable to the background of the View, via DrawableUtils or via layout's item: android:background="?attr/selectableItemBackground", pointing to a custom Drawable in the style.xml (note: prefix ?android:attr doesn't work).

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the item to toggle the selection status for.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • addSelection

        public final boolean addSelection(int position)
        Adds the selection status for the given position without notifying the change.
        Parameters:
        position - Position of the item to add the selection status for.
        Returns:
        true if the set is modified, false otherwise or position is not currently selectable
        Since:
        5.0.0-b7
        See Also:
        isSelectable(int)

      • swapSelection

                             int toPosition)
        Helper method to easily swap selection between 2 positions only if one of the positions is not selected.
        Parameters:
        fromPosition - first position
        toPosition - second position

      • selectAll

        public void selectAll(java.lang.Integer... viewTypes)
        Sets the selection status for all items which the ViewTypes are included in the specified array.
        Parameters:
        viewTypes - The ViewTypes for which we want the selection, pass nothing to select all
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • clearSelection

        public void clearSelection()
        Clears the selection status for all items one by one and it doesn't stop animations in the items.

        Note 1: Items are not rebound, so an eventual animation is not stopped!
        Note 2: This method use java.util.Iterator on synchronized collection to avoid java.util.ConcurrentModificationException.

        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setFastScroller

        public void setFastScroller(@Nullable
                            FastScroller fastScroller)
        Sets up the FastScroller with automatic fetch of accent color.

        IMPORTANT: Call this method after the adapter is added to the RecyclerView.

        NOTE: If the device has at least Lollipop, the Accent color is fetched, otherwise for previous version, the default value is used.
        Specified by:
        setFastScroller in interface FastScroller.AdapterInterface
        Parameters:
        fastScroller - instance of FastScroller
        Since:
        5.0.0-b6

        Parameters:
        position - the position of the handle
        Returns:
        the value of the item, default value is: position + 1
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

        Parameters:
